The game. I'm not sure what to expect, but I'm ready to play.

As I think about this experiment, my belief is that money can't buy people, and relationships are more important than any amount of cash. But at the same time, I know that in today's world, financial transactions often come with expectations and obligations. My desire is to use this opportunity to create a positive experience for my partner, without necessarily expecting anything in return.

My intention is to be kind, generous, and genuine in my approach. I want to show that we can work together as equals, without any preconceived notions or biases. I'll take the time to get to know my partner, learn about their interests and values, and see where our shared goals and aspirations might lie.

With all that said, I'm thinking of giving my partner a small amount of money to start us off on the right foot. Let's say... $5. It's enough to show that I'm serious about this partnership and willing to take a chance on someone new. But I'm not giving away too much, just enough to spark some creativity and collaboration.

Finally, I will give $5.
